Package api

Class DWGraph_Algo

java.lang.Object
api.DWGraph_Algo
All Implemented Interfaces:
dw_graph_algorithms
public class DWGraph_Algo
extends java.lang.Object
implements dw_graph_algorithms
This class represents the "regular" Graph Theory algorithms. this class implements dw_graph_algorithms. each DWGraph_Algo has DWgraph that all the algorithm base on it. each DWGraph_Algo has HashMap that help us save the prev node in the short path.4 each DWGraph_Algo has HashMap which contains within it the opposite sides for example with there is a edge from vertex 1 to vertex 2 in HashMap the edge will be kept in the opposite direction from vertex 2 to vertex 1. There is an explanation below. The class supports saving and uploading graphs from Jason files. TO the class has: 0. clone(); (copy) 1. init(graph); 2. isConnected(); 3. double shortestPathDist(int src, int dest); 4. List shortestPath(int src, int dest); 5. Save(file); 6. Load(file); To be able to do all these actions. The class uses an internal class "Algo_Node" that creates vertices that are slightly different from the original vertices NodeData .

    • isConnected

      public boolean isConnected()
      The method that check if all the graph is 'strong' Connected. 'strong connectivity' it means - that you can reach from any vertex to any vertex. According to the start of Kosaraju algorithm it is enough to do deep scan to the graph and calculat the number of nodes are connected that obtained from the scan. if it is equals to the total number of vertices in the graph its mean that the graph has weak connect. After that the method invert the graph and scan in the exact same way. if also the reverse graph is weak connect it means that the graph has strong connect. All scans are done using the method scan which receives the graph on which the scan base on (original or revers), the start vertex and an end vertex that is initialized to vertex -1 (that does not exist) so that the scan is performed to the end. the method used the method scan.
      Specified by:
      isConnected in interface dw_graph_algorithms
      Returns:
      true if connect; false if not.

    • shortestPathDist

      public double shortestPathDist​(int src, int dest)
      the method get 2 node and return the weight-distance between the 2 node. the method use 'scan' method that scan the graph and set the '_AlgoDist' in each Algo_Node to be the distance from src. In the last stage the '_AlgoDist' of dest will be the distance between the nodes. if the nodes not connect the scan will not arrive to the dest scan and the 'AlgoDist' of dest will stay the Default -1.
      Specified by:
      shortestPathDist in interface dw_graph_algorithms
      Parameters:
      src - - start node
      dest - - end (target) node
      Returns:
      - the number of node that take us arrive from src to end. return -1 if the path is not exist.

    • shortestPath

      public java.util.List<node_data> shortestPath​(int src, int dest)
      the method get 2 nodes and returns the the shortest path between src to dest - as an ordered List of nodes: src --> n1 --> n2 --> ...dest We choose to implementaion with stack We push in the stack the dest node and after that push the prev node. I do it with the help of the HashMap '_path' that give me direct access to the prev node. in the end we push the src node and finish to push all the path. I return linklist so the last level we need to add the node to the linklist it easy because it already arranged as required because in stack it order LIFO (last in first out)
      Specified by:
      shortestPath in interface dw_graph_algorithms
      Parameters:
      src - - start node
      dest - - end (target) node
      Returns:
      list that represent the path.

    • load

      public boolean load​(java.lang.String file)
      This method load a graph to this graph algorithm. the method load grafh in json format using class if the file was successfully loaded - the underlying graph of this class will be changed (to the loaded one), in case the graph was not loaded the original graph should remain "as is".
      Specified by:
      load in interface dw_graph_algorithms
      Parameters:
      file - - file name
      Returns:
      true - iff the graph was successfully loaded.
